ARTICLE.TITLE: China FURY: Beijing erupts as US nears key deal with Israel ‘scandalous!’
ARTICLE.TEXT:
FREE now and never miss the top politics stories again. SUBSCRIBE Invalid email Sign up fornow and never miss the top politics stories again. We will use your email address only for sending you newsletters. Please see our Privacy Notice for details of your data protection rights.

Chen Weihua from the Chinese state outlet the China Daily described Beijing's indignation: "This is scandalous and ungrateful. Chinese cities like Shanghai provided a safe haven to some 30,000 Jews fleeing Nazi Europe in WWII, but now Israel returns the favor by being a US poodle against China in 5G."

Chinese state tabloid the Global Times has warned Israel's cooperation with China could be in jeopardy because of the movements with the US over 5G. The Global Times said: "In the future this may affect normal economic, trade and investment activities between China and Israel. "China-Israel relations are unlikely to be substantially hit by groundless allegations by some senior US officials, but China should act more cautiously when trading with or investing in Israel." The Jerusalem Post reported the intention of Israel in following the US lead on using Huawei. JUST IN: World War 3: Moscow probed US over 'joint attack on China'

Israel may follow the US lead by not using Huawei

The newspaper read, "Israel will choose to only allow trusted vendors in its 5G networks." The US side welcomed Tel Aviv's wariness in using Huawei. A statement from the state department said: "There is a long-term threat to data privacy, security, and human rights posed to the free world from authoritarian malign actors, such as the Chinese Communist Party, CCP." The Clean Network is the US government's latest move to cut Chinese companies out of the US networks. DON'T MISS China threat: Beijing brands Hong Kong newspaper owner 'traitor' [Update]

WW3: India pressured to TOUGHEN stance on China [Insight]

US and China in last-ditch phone call to avoid South China Sea war [Latest]

There are concerns about Huawei and cyber-security

The Clean Network initiative is a combined multi-national plan to ensure high-risk Chinese companies, that are compromised by the Chinese government, do not commit cyber-espionage in the countries that have joined the initiative. The following countries; Israel, Australia, Canada, Japan, Taiwan and the EU are partners with the US in The Clean Network initiative. Ministry spokesman Zhao Lijian responded by saying: "The practice of politicising the 5G issue is not conducive to the development of the technology, goes against the principle of fair competition and is not in line with the common interests of the international community." Mr Zhao said he believes there is a hidden motivation behind certain US politicians in calling for a Huawei ban.

China and the US are at loggerheads

Trending

METADATA.description: CHINA has erupted in fury after receiving news that Israel and the United States are nearing a deal where Tel Aviv would ban the use of Huawei from their 5G development.
